questions.guidance_text: Enter your company's full legal name exactly as registered with the Registrar of Companies. This name will appear on your insurance policy and must match your GST registration and other legal documents for smooth claim processing.
questions.placeholder: e.g., ABC Trading Company Pvt Ltd

questions.guidance_text: Provide your complete business address where all insurance-related communications will be sent. Include building name/number, street, area, city, state, and pincode for accurate delivery of policy documents and correspondence.
questions.placeholder: e.g., 304, Sunrise Tower, MG Road, Andheri West, Mumbai, Maharashtra - 400058

questions.guidance_text: Name of the authorized person who will handle all insurance matters and can make decisions on behalf of your company. This person will receive all policy updates and be the primary point of contact for claims.

Enter the 10-digit mobile number without country code or spaces. This number will be used for urgent communications about your shipments, claims notifications, and policy renewals. Ensure it's always reachable during business hours.

Provide an active business email address that is checked regularly. All policy documents, renewal notices, and claim forms will be sent to this email. Avoid using personal email addresses for better business continuity.

Select the policy start date (typically should be at least 2-3 days from today to allow processing time). STOP policies usually run for one year and automatically cover all your shipments during this period based on your declared annual turnover.
Select the policy end date (typically one year from start date). All shipments dispatched between start and end dates will be automatically covered without needing individual declarations.

Select all types of goods movement your business undertakes. STOP insurance can cover multiple transit types under one policy, eliminating the need for separate policies. This helps ensure no shipment goes uninsured.
If you selected 'Other' above, please describe the specific type of transit or goods movement that needs coverage. This helps insurers understand your unique requirements.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Exhibition goods movement, Sample transfers

questions.guidance_text: List the main locations from where your goods typically originate. Include city and state for domestic shipments, or country and port for international. You can mention multiple locations if your business operates from various points.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Mumbai Port (Maharashtra) for imports, Pune Factory (Maharashtra) for domestic sales

questions.guidance_text: List the main destinations where your goods are typically delivered. This helps insurers assess route risks and determine appropriate coverage terms. Include major cities, states, or countries you regularly ship to.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai for domestic; Dubai, Singapore for exports

questions.question_text: Are there multiple routes or transit legs involved?
questions.guidance_text: Select 'Yes' if your shipments typically involve transshipment, multi-modal transport (like sea + road), or pass through multiple warehouses. This is common for import/export businesses or hub-and-spoke distribution models.
Describe the typical journey of your goods including all intermediate stops, warehouses, or transshipment points. This helps ensure coverage throughout the entire supply chain without gaps.
questions.placeholder: e.g., China Port → Mumbai Port (Sea) → Mumbai Warehouse → Various cities across India (Road)

questions.guidance_text: Select all transportation modes used for your shipments. Different modes have different risk levels - air cargo has less risk but higher value exposure, while road transport may have more frequent but smaller claims. Premium rates vary by mode.

This determines how much you'll be compensated in case of a claim. 'Invoice + 10%' is common as it covers the goods value plus incidental costs. For exports, CIF (Cost, Insurance, Freight) + 10% is standard. Choose based on your business model.
If you selected 'Other', please explain your specific valuation method. Some businesses use custom formulas based on their unique pricing models.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Purchase cost + 15% profit margin + freight

questions.guidance_text: Describe how your goods are typically packed for transit. Better packing reduces damage risk and can lower premiums. Include details like cartons, wooden crates, pallets, bubble wrap, or special handling for fragile items.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Electronic goods in individual boxes with foam padding, 20 boxes per wooden crate, shrink-wrapped on pallets

questions.question_text: Per Bottom Limit (Maximum value per vehicle/vessel)
questions.guidance_text: Enter the maximum value of goods you would load in a single vehicle, vessel, or aircraft. This is your maximum risk exposure per conveyance. If a truck carrying ₹50 lakhs of goods meets an accident, this should be at least ₹50 lakhs for full coverage.

questions.question_text: Per Location Limit (Maximum value stored at any location)
questions.guidance_text: Enter the maximum value of goods that might be stored at any single warehouse or location during transit. This covers temporary storage during transshipment or at intermediate points. Consider your peak inventory periods.

questions.question_text: Estimated Annual Sales Turnover for Transit Insurance
questions.guidance_text: Enter the total estimated value of all goods that will be transported during the policy period. This is the basis for STOP insurance premium calculation. Include all sales, transfers, and movements you want covered. Underestimating can lead to penalties.

Optional: Break down your annual turnover by transit type (e.g., 40% imports, 30% domestic sales, 30% exports). This helps insurers better understand your risk profile and may result in more competitive premiums.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Imports: ₹10 Cr (40%), Domestic Sales: ₹7.5 Cr (30%), Exports: ₹7.5 Cr (30%)

questions.guidance_text: Provide details of all transit-related insurance claims in the last 5 years, even if with different insurers. Include year, claim amount, cause (damage, theft, accident), and current status. Write 'No claims' if claim-free. Honest disclosure ensures smooth future claims.
questions.placeholder:
e.g., FY 2023-24: ₹2,50,000 - Road accident damage, Settled
FY 2022-23: No claims
FY 2021-22: ₹75,000 - Water damage during monsoon, Settled

questions.guidance_text: Have you implemented any measures to reduce transit risks? This includes GPS tracking, approved transporter lists, route planning, security escorts, or improved packaging. Such measures can significantly reduce your premium.

Describe all safety measures you've implemented. Include technology (GPS, locks), processes (verified transporters, defined routes), and packaging improvements. Demonstrating proactive risk management often leads to premium discounts.
questions.placeholder: e.g., 1) GPS tracking on all vehicles 2) Use only empaneled transporters 3) Avoid night travel for high-value goods 4) Enhanced packaging standards 5) Regular driver training

questions.guidance_text: Declare if you have any unsettled claims with current or previous insurers. This won't necessarily increase your premium but non-disclosure can void your policy. Transparency is crucial for valid coverage.
Provide details of all pending claims including date of incident, estimated claim amount, current status, and reason for delay. Include claim numbers if available for faster verification.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Claim dated 15/01/2025, Amount: ₹3,50,000, Status: Under survey, Reason: Damage during transit, Claim No: 2025/MAR/1234

questions.guidance_text: Describe the types of products you transport. Be specific - electronics, textiles, machinery, perishables, chemicals, etc. Different goods have different risk profiles and coverage requirements. Hazardous goods may need special coverage.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Consumer electronics (mobiles, laptops), Home appliances, Electronic components and spare parts

questions.guidance_text: Mention any specific coverage needs, exclusions you want removed, or special conditions for your business. Include seasonal variations, new routes planned, or any other information that helps insurers understand your needs better.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Need coverage for exhibition goods, Require war risk coverage for Middle East exports, Peak season October-December with 40% higher turnover

questions.guidance_text: If you had STOP or marine insurance before, mention the insurance company name. This helps in getting your claims history and can expedite the quotation process.
questions.placeholder: e.g., New India Assurance Co. Ltd.

questions.guidance_text: If you had previous marine/STOP insurance, provide the policy number for reference. This helps verify your claims history and may qualify you for no-claim bonuses.
Upload your previous year's STOP/Marine policy if available (PDF format preferred). This helps insurers understand your current coverage and offer better terms. Maximum file size 5MB.
If available, upload a claims experience certificate from your previous insurer. This document validates your claims history and can help secure better premium rates for good claims experience.

Upload supporting documents showing your annual transit volume or sales turnover (like audited financials, GST returns, or transit registers). This helps validate the declared turnover and ensures accurate premium calculation.
